Description: A brief description of a feature from the perspective of an end-user.
A large body of work that can be broken down into smaller user stories.
Conditions that must be met for a user story to be considered complete.
A requirement that specifies a function that a system must perform.
A requirement that specifies criteria that judge the operation of a system, rather than specific behaviors.
A concept in software development that reflects the eventual cost of additional rework caused by choosing an easy solution now instead of using a better approach that would take longer.
A measure of the effort required to implement a requirement.
A relationship between requirements where one requirement cannot be completed without another.
The process of ranking requirements based on business value, risk, and effort.
A unit of measure for expressing an estimate of the overall effort required to fully implement a product backlog item or any other piece of work.
An ongoing process in which the Product Owner and the Development Team collaborate on the details of Product Backlog items.
An event in SCRUM where the team selects items from the product backlog to work on during the upcoming sprint.
A shared understanding of what it means for work to be complete on the Scrum Team.
